The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to semi-shaded environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, clustered fruits that contain seeds. Sacciolepis mukuku is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
